歶字的基本解释

歶
yú
铜鱼，丧车的装饰：“无帾丝歶缕翣，其貌以象菲帷帱尉也。”

歶字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yú］
丧车的装饰。

歶字的康熙字典解释

【補遺】【午集】【禸字部】　歶； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页577第13
【字彙補】音未詳。【荀子·禮論篇】絲歶縷翣。【註】絲歶未詳，蓋亦喪車之飾。或曰歶讀爲魚，謂以銅魚懸於地下，縷讀爲柳，蔞字誤爲縷字耳。

歶字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
歶字的起名意思

暂无。

Shao
Basic explanation of words
Shao
yú
Bronze fish, the decoration of the funeral car: "Wu-silk wisps, and its appearance is like the Philippine curtain."
Shao
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yú］
Decoration of funeral car.
Shao
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Supplement] [Won Collection] [Xi Zi Department] 　歶; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 577 13
[Vocabulary complement] The sound is not specified. 【Xunzi·Ritual Theory】Silks wispy. [Note] The silk shaw is not known, and the cover is also a decoration of the car. Or it is said that the word "歶" is pronounced as fish, which means that the bronze fish is suspended in the ground, the word "Liu" is pronounced as willow, and the word "Lou" is mistaken as the word "Liu".
